title: Multiline (more than 2 lines) inner attribute triggers ICE during doctest

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Following code produces triggers an ICE when running `cargo test` or `cargo doctest`: ### Code ```Rust //! ```rust //! #![deny( //! unused_parens, //! )] //! ``` ``` [Open the code on playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=80df494ade4870d9940f4c267c8a5ee1) ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.63.0-nightly (4cbaac699 2022-05-25) binary: rustc commit-hash: 4cbaac699c14b7ac7cc80e54823b2ef6afeb64af commit-date: 2022-05-25 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.63.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.4 ```
Backtrace

``` running 0 tests test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s running 1 test test src/lib.rs - (line 1) ... FAILED failures: ---- src/lib.rs - (line 1) stdout ---- thread 'src/lib.rs - (line 1)' panicked at 'explicit panic', compiler/rustc_errors/src/diagnostic_builder.rs:553:21 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7faf6fdc21cd -
